summary.p: 98 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: Y. 4566; Qurʾānic Text: Q 24:21-29:84; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 220 x 260mm; Script style: maghribī.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 25: "74 Y. 4566. Kur’andan bir bölüm. Parşömen. 260mm boy ve 220mm eninde 98 yaprak. Sahifede harekeli mağrib yazısı ile 150mm uzunl.[uğunda] 7 satır. Üzerinde Hasan Baṣrī (öl. 110/128-29) hattı ile yazıyor ise de bunun IV. (X) asırdan evvel yazılmış olması muhtemel değildir. İlk iki ve son iki sahifedeki zahriyelerle sure başları, güller Arap üslûbunda müzehheptir. İlk sahifesinde I. ʿAbdulḥamid’in vakıf kaydı ve mührü vardır. Miklepli nefti ve kırmızı deri cilt. Bu cilt Nūr (24) suresinin 21. ayetinden ʿAnkabūt (29) suresinin 84. ayetine kadardır."

This can be translated as follows: "74 Y. 4566. A part of the Qurʾān. Parchment. 98 leaves of 260 mm height and 220 mm width. The text area written with vowel marked Maghribi script [contains] 7 lines measuring 150 mm. While it is stated that it is written in the script of el-Ḥasan al-Baṣrī (d. 110/128-29), it is unlikely to have been written before the 4th (10th) century. The zahriye on the first and last two leaves, the sūra beginnings and roses are decorated in the Arabic style. Contains waqf registration and seal of ʿAbdulḥamid I on the first leaf. Dark green leather binding with red color and a flap (miklep). This part is from the beginning of the Q 24:21 (Sūra al-Nūr), until the Q 29:84 (Sūra al-ʿAnkabūt).”
